Description: In some animals, sex is determined by the combination of sex chromosomes received from the parents. For example, in humans and dragons, females have two X chromosomes while males have one X and one Y.
Only one dominant allele is needed to produce the dominant trait.
Two recessive alleles are needed to produce a recessive trait.
"Use a genotype to predict the phenotype for an organism."

column3: determine possible genotypes for an organism."

Description: "Create or select parental gametes to create an individual offspring with a specific phenotype."
"Set parental genotypes to produce a specific pattern of offspring."
